result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:11 AM Defendant Ray A Hernandez in court.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant was denied at the State Public Defender's Office.
Court passes matter to allow the defendant to complete the petition for appointment of counsel.
Case recalled at 11:23.
Court reviews petition for appointment of counsel.
Defendant sworn in and testified.
Court grants petition and orders an attorney appointed for the defendant.  Defendant to pay $200.00 per month commencing 10/7/22.
Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.  **Rescheduled due to conflict with the Court's calendar.**

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant listed in the Criminal Complaint.

01:38 PM Defendant Ray A Hernandez in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
